caption: HTTP Activity
description: HTTP Activity events report HTTP connection and traffic information.
name: http_activity

activity.description: The normalized caption of 'activity_id' or the source specific value.

1.caption: Connect
1.description: The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

2.caption: Delete
2.description: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

3.caption: Get
3.description: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

4.caption: Head
4.description: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to a GET request, but without the response body.

5.caption: Options
5.description: The OPTIONS method describes the communication options for the target resource.

6.caption: Post
6.description: The POST method submits an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

7.caption: Put
7.description: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

8.caption: Trace
8.description: The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

app_name.description: The name of the application that initiated the DHCP connection.

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

4002.caption: HTTP Activity
4002.description: HTTP Activity events report HTTP connection and traffic information.

connection_info.description: The connection information relevant to the network traffic.

dst_endpoint.description: The responder (server) in a network connection.

file.description: The file that is the target of the SSH activity.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The Firewall Rule object represents a specific rule within a firewall policy or event. It contains information about a rule's configuration, properties, and associated actions that define how network traffic is handled by the firewall.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description:
The Policy object describes the policies that are applicable.

Policy attributes provide traceability to the operational state of the security product at the time that the event was captured, facilitating forensics, troubleshooting, and policy tuning/adjustments.
policy.name: policy

src_endpoint.description: The initiator (client) in a network connection.

traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

400200.caption: Unknown
400200.description: The activity type "HTTP Activity: Unknown" is not further specified.

400201.caption: Connect
400201.description: The HTTP CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

400202.caption: Delete
400202.description: The HTTP DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

400203.caption: Get
400203.description: The HTTP GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

400204.caption: Head
400204.description: The HTTP HEAD method asks for a response identical to a GET request, but without the response body.

400205.caption: Options
400205.description: The HTTP OPTIONS method describes the communication options for the target resource.

400206.caption: Post
400206.description: The HTTP POST method submits an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

400207.caption: Put
400207.description: The HTTP PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

400208.caption: Trace
400208.description: The HTTP TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

400299.caption: Other
400299.description: The activity type "HTTP Activity: Other" is not further specified.
